basics.name: Michael Jirasek
basics.label: Research Fellow & Team Leader in AI-Driven Chemistry Automation
basics.summary: I am a research fellow and team leader in a research group at the University of Glasgow. With the team, I focus on digitizing chemistry. This involves building in-house robotic platforms, programming robots for chemical experiments, and implementing algorithms for online data analysis. I am developing and implementing machine learning algorithms for chemical robots to make autonomous decisions for the next experiment. I have co-authored 24 peer-reviewed scientific publications and one patent.

work.name: University of Glasgow
work.summary: Leading a diverse team of 9 researchers and graduate students in AI-driven chemistry automation. Implementing state-of-the-art large language models (LLMs) in automated chemistry laboratories, creating self-training robotic platforms for novel chemistry discoveries.
highlights: Leading and managing a diverse team of 9 researchers and graduate students
Implementing state-of-the-art large language models (LLMs) in automated chemistry laboratory
Designing and building chemical robotic prototypes using CAD software
Programming microcontroller firmware (Arduino and ESP32) and Python control software
Developing fully autonomous robotic platforms for chemical reactions and NMR analysis
Securing $1.25 million grant from the Sloan Foundation
Simulating 100,000s of IR, NMR and MS spectra for theoretical studies
Conducting high-throughput experiments on automated platforms

work.name: ETH Zurich
work.summary: Developed novel soft materials by synthesizing collagen-like peptides combined with metals, analyzing their structure through transmission electron microscopy and XRD. Supervised master students and designed research projects.
highlights: Synthesising modified amino acids and peptides using SSPS
Fabricating large supramolecular assemblies and confirming structure with TEM
Designing bio-compatible porous peptide-based metal-organic frameworks
Supervising master students and devising research objectives

work.name: University of Oxford
work.summary: Developed MATLAB software to process NMR data from published literature during COVID lockdown. Conducted quantum chemical studies on molecular flexibility and aromaticity with findings published in top peer-reviewed journals.
highlights: Conceiving and developing original MATLAB software for predicting ring currents
Parsing NMR data from literature and interpreting using custom software
Computationally (DFT) and experimentally (NMR) studying aromaticity and ring-currents

work.name: Institute of Organic Chemistry and Biochemistry, Czech Academy of Sciences
work.summary: Synthesized a library of over 200 novel azonia-helicenes and their full characterization as potential drug candidates for affecting telomerase activity. Screened for racemic conglomerate crystals using advanced techniques.
highlights: Synthesizing library of over 200 novel azonia-helicenes
Full characterization as potential drug candidates for telomerase activity
Screening for racemic conglomerate crystals by detecting second-harmonic generation and XRD
Organic compound synthesis for biological testing

thesis.title: Exploring electronic delocalization in porphyrin oligomers
thesis.summary: The thesis describes experimental evidence that aromaticity does not have size limit in the nanoscale, evidenced by synthesis of the largest aromatic compound ever reported - a ring of 12 porphyrins with over 160 π electrons. The work includes creating twisted porphyrin rings in a Möbius strip shape, combining unusual topology with aromaticity.

highlights: Synthesis of largest aromatic compound ever reported
Advanced time-resolved infrared techniques
Creating twisted porphyrin rings in Möbius strip shape

thesis.title: Organocatalytic [2+2] photocycloadditions of nitrogen-containing dienes
thesis.summary: Series of substituted bis(allyl)amines were synthesized and characterized. The substrates were tested toward [2+2] cycloadditions promoted by visible light facilitated by flavin organocatalysis.
